snippet: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell’s compensation in 2012 made him among the best-paid executives in the country and perhaps the highest-paid leader of a nonprofit organization.
abstract: NFL commissioner Roger Goodell was paid $44.2 million in 2012, making him among the best-paid executives in the country and perhaps the highest-paid leader of a nonprofit organization; amount, including deferred bonus and pension payment of $9.1 million, represents 50 percent increase from 2011.
lead_paragraph: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell’s compensation in 2012 made him among the best-paid executives in the country and perhaps the highest-paid leader of a nonprofit organization.

headline.main: Goodell’s Pay of $44.2 Million in 2012 Puts Him in the Big Leagues
headline.print_headline: Goodell’s Pay in 2012 Puts Him in Big Leagues
